title: Frontier LLM tier list
subtitle: A personal, time-indexed ranking of frontier models.

model.name: GPT-5.2
model.summary: Exceptional instruction following and long-term agentic capabilities
model.reasoning: This is the smartest model at the moment, in terms of raw intelligence and reasoning capabilities. Others don't even come close in programming and math. It is so obvious once you actually use it for anything complex enough that it was really weird for me to see most people prefer Opus 4.5 instead.

model.name: GPT-5.2-Codex
model.summary: Worse than GPT-5.2 in general, but more efficient when working with code
model.reasoning: This is a good model, but it feels overtuned in a way that actually makes it worse than GPT-5.2 in instruction following. I saw some people having a similar experience with it. I personally don't really use it, and always prefer GPT-5.2.

model.name: Opus 4.5
model.summary: Good and fast chat model that also has some taste
model.reasoning: I don't use it for code as GPT-5.2 is far superior, but it's a nice chat model that reminds me of GPT-4o in a good way and it's smart enough for daily usage in random questions. It also works well with text and with design if you explain to it the vibe you want.

model.name: Gemini 3 Pro
model.summary: Has some raw intelligence but is unusable in practice
model.reasoning: I really tried to believe that it is a good model. But I just can't get anything useful out of it really. I still believe that it has raw intelligence in it, but Google just can't do proper post-train yet and this model is just really unusable. It doesn't follow instructions in the same way Gemini 2.5 didn't, and it is very lazy and doesn't want to think at all, even for the hardest questions. It doesn't think deeply about things unless you start handholding it. I don't recommend it for anything.

model.name: Sonnet 4.5
model.reasoning: Opus 4.5 is not much more expensive and delivers far better results, so I don't see any point in using Sonnet 4.5 unless you're seeking some cost efficiency but in that case there are better options than Anthropic.
